title: Getting different forecast in Qlik Sense with Prophet
body:
I'm trying to reproduce in Qlik Sense the forecasting example found in the Prophet docs where a multivariate regressor it's used but I'm getting different kind of forecast with less performance than applying the model direct in Python without the SSE funcionality.

**To Reproduce**
1. Using bike rentals, holidays and weather conditions (temp, rain, sun, wind) datasets from this example: https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/nicolasfauchereau/Auckland_Cycling/blob/master/notebooks/Auckland_cycling_and_weather.ipynb
2. Using the same parameters to the model 
3. Using the same period of time to train and test sets

**Expected behavior**
Expecting to have the same forecasting behaivor since we are using the same parameters and random seed for the model

**Screenshots**
1.- Datasets
- Python
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875538-e6181d80-1f7b-11ea-86d1-5965b31c7289.png)

- Pytools
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875556-f3cda300-1f7b-11ea-87e0-7d040feae72a.png)

2.- Parameters
- Python
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875587-0647dc80-1f7c-11ea-9661-f0bb8f86b8ea.png)

- Pytools
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875595-0b0c9080-1f7c-11ea-875c-1218137e380b.png)

3.- Same periods - Different Results
- Python
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875616-22e41480-1f7c-11ea-9e04-f5c660e6262e.png)

- Pytools
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691464/70875622-27103200-1f7c-11ea-8a58-eccb6fcedf84.png)

**Environment:**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Qlik Sense Desktop
 - SSE Version: qlik-py-tools version 6.2

I've tried but can't found any possible source of the difference in both.
